{{ NCAATeamSeason | Mode = football | Year = 1908 | Team = Nebraska Cornhuskers | Logo = | LogoSize = | LogoAlt = | Image = 1908 Nebraska Cornhuskers football team.jpg | ImageSize = | ImageAlt = | Conference = Missouri Valley Intercollegiate Athletic Association | Division = | ShortConference = MVIAA | BCSRank = | CoachRank = | APRank = | Record = 7-2-1 | ConfRecord = 2-1-0 | WinsVacated = | WinsForfeited = | ConfWinsVacated = | ConfWinsForfeited = | HeadCoach = [[William C. "King" Cole]] | HCYear = 2nd | OffCoach = | OCYear = | DefCoach = | DCYear = | OScheme = | DScheme = | StadiumArena = Antelope Field | Champion = | BowlTourney = | BowlTourneyResult = | ConfChamp = | ConfChampResult = }} {{1908 Missouri Valley football standings}} The '''1908 Nebraska Cornhuskers football team''' was the representative of the [[University of Nebraska-Lincoln|University of Nebraska]] in the [[1908 college football season]]. The team was coached by [[William C. "King" Cole]] and played their home games at Antelope Field in [[Lincoln, Nebraska]]. ==Before the season== Coach Cole brought his 8-2 record from 1907 with him into his second year at Nebraska. Plans were beginning to materialize to replace Antelope Field, and this season would feature a visit from legend-in-the-making [[Jim Thorpe]]. ==Schedule== {{Cite web|url=http://www.huskers.com/SportSelect.dbml?SPSID=3&SPID=22&DB_OEM_ID=100&KEY=&Q_SEASON=1908 |title =Football - 1908 Schedule/Results |accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=University of Nebraska-Lincoln Athletics Department}} {| class="wikitable" |- ! '''Peru State at Nebraska'''
12Total
[[Peru State College|Peru State]] 0
'''â¢ Nebraska''' 20
* '''Date:''' 1908-09-26 * '''Location:''' Antelope Field â¢ [[Lincoln, Nebraska]]
Nebraska again opened the season against Peru State, and again made an easy win out of it, advancing their all-time record against the Peru State teachers to 2-0. {{Cite web|url=http://www.huskernews.com/vnews/display.v/ART/2006/05/13/4478881d5e6a8?in_archive=1|title=1908 Game Recaps|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=Husker Press Box}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.huskermax.com/1900s.html|title=the 1900s|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=HuskerMax}} {{-}} ===Doane===
'''Doane at Nebraska'''
12Total
[[Doane College|Doane]] 0
'''â¢ Nebraska''' 43
* '''Date:''' 1908-10-03 * '''Location:''' Antelope Field â¢ Lincoln, Nebraska
Nebraska committed numerous errors which prevented them from scoring as often as they could have, but it was just as well for Doane so that they didn't have an even more painful blanking than the 0-43 outcome. Doane fell further in the series to 2-12. {{Cite web|url=http://www.huskernews.com/vnews/display.v/ART/2006/05/13/4478881d5e6a8?in_archive=1|title=1908 Game Recaps|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=Husker Press Box}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.huskermax.com/1900s.html|title=the 1900s|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=HuskerMax}} {{-}} ===Grinnell===
'''Grinnell at Nebraska'''
12Total
[[Grinnell College|Grinnell]] 5
'''â¢ Nebraska''' 20
* '''Date:''' 1908-10-10 * '''Location:''' Antelope Field â¢ Lincoln, Nebraska
Long suffering from a lengthening string of Nebraska victories, Grinnell got the attention of the Cornhuskers by scoring first in this game. Nebraska responded by keeping them off the board for the rest of the game while attaching four of their own touchdowns to advance to 6-2 in the series. {{Cite web|url=http://www.huskernews.com/vnews/display.v/ART/2006/05/13/4478881d5e6a8?in_archive=1|title=1908 Game Recaps|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=Husker Press Box}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.huskermax.com/1900s.html|title=the 1900s|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=HuskerMax}} {{-}} ===Minnesota===
'''Nebraska at Minnesota'''
12Total
Nebraska 000
[[1908 Minnesota Golden Gophers football team|Minnesota]] 000
* '''Date:''' 1908-10-17 * '''Location:''' Northrop Field â¢ [[Minneapolis|Minneapolis, Minnesota]]
Nebraska once again traveled north to Minneapolis on another mission to attempt to take down the mighty Golden Gophers. Both teams made it a defensive game, with both sides making impressive goal line stands, and when time ran out there were still no points on the board. Holding Minnesota to a scoreless tie was still a big improvement to break the 4-game win streak held by Minnesota in the series, though it didn't contribute a great deal towards Nebraska making up their 1-6-1 series deficit. {{Cite web|url=http://www.huskernews.com/vnews/display.v/ART/2006/05/13/4478881d5e6a8?in_archive=1|title=1908 Game Recaps|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=Husker Press Box}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.huskermax.com/1900s.html|title=the 1900s|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=HuskerMax}} {{-}} ===Haskell===
'''Haskell at Nebraska'''
12Total
[[Haskell Indian Nations University|Haskell]] 0
'''â¢ Nebraska''' 10
* '''Date:''' 1908-10-24 * '''Location:''' Antelope Field â¢ Lincoln, Nebraska
Nebraska didn't put up such a large score, but held Haskell to zero to notch up a 3rd shutout in the last four games, moving to 4-1 against the Indians. {{Cite web|url=http://www.huskernews.com/vnews/display.v/ART/2006/05/13/4478881d5e6a8?in_archive=1|title=1908 Game Recaps|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=Husker Press Box}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.huskermax.com/1900s.html|title=the 1900s|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=HuskerMax}} {{-}} ===Iowa===
'''Nebraska at Iowa'''
12Total
'''â¢ Nebraska''' 11
{{cfb link|year=1908|school=University of Iowa|team=Iowa Hawkeyes|title=Iowa}} 8
* '''Date:''' 1908-10-31 * '''Location:''' [[Iowa City, Iowa]]
After a three-year break, Nebraska and Iowa resumed their series. Any thoughts of an easy Cornhusker victory to start the season's conference slate were quickly replaced by the reality of a struggle in which Nebraska barely escaped with a 3-point win, moving to a 7-4-2 advantage over the Hawkeyes all time. {{Cite web|url=http://www.huskernews.com/vnews/display.v/ART/2006/05/13/4478881d5e6a8?in_archive=1|title=1908 Game Recaps|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=Husker Press Box}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.huskermax.com/1900s.html|title=the 1900s|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=HuskerMax}} {{-}} ===Iowa State===
'''Nebraska vs. Iowa State'''
12Total
'''â¢ Nebraska''' 23
{{cfb link|year=1908|school=Iowa State University|team=Iowa State Cyclones|title=Iowa State}} 17
* '''Date:''' 1908-11-07 2:30 PM Kickoff * '''Location:''' Dietz Park â¢ [[Omaha, Nebraska]]
For the second week in a row, the Cornhuskers found themselves fighting for the win against a team from Iowa. The Cyclones fought to a 17-17 tie in the 2nd half, but Nebraska found a way to score one more time to increase their series lead to 7-3. {{Cite web|url=http://www.huskernews.com/vnews/display.v/ART/2006/05/13/4478881d5e6a8?in_archive=1|title=1908 Game Recaps|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=Husker Press Box}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.huskermax.com/1900s.html|title=the 1900s|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=HuskerMax}} {{-}} ===Kansas===
'''Kansas at Nebraska'''
12Total
'''â¢ {{cfb link|year=1908|school=University of Kansas|team=Kansas Jayhawks|title=Kansas}}''' 16420
Nebraska 505
* '''Date:''' 1908-11-14 * '''Location:''' Antelope Field â¢ Lincoln, Nebraska
Nebraska players accused Kansas of spying on the team practices or otherwise improperly obtaining the signals called by the Cornhuskers, but whether that was true or Kansas was just that good, Nebraska fell at home 5-20 in a loss that handed the Jayhawks the conference championship and narrowed the Nebraska series edge to 8-7. The home defeat snapped an 11-game home field winning streak, and was the first since a 6-8 loss also delivered by Kansas in 1906. {{Cite web|url=http://www.huskernews.com/vnews/display.v/ART/2006/05/13/4478881d5e6a8?in_archive=1|title=1908 Game Recaps|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=Husker Press Box}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.huskermax.com/1900s.html|title=the 1900s|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=HuskerMax}} {{-}} ===Wabash===
'''Wabash at Nebraska'''
12Total
[[Wabash Little Giants|Wabash]] 6
'''â¢ Nebraska''' 27
* '''Date:''' 1908-11-26 * '''Location:''' Antelope Field â¢ Lincoln, Nebraska * '''Game weather:''' Snow
This was the only time Wabash met Nebraska to settle affairs on the football field, and the muddy, snowy day was all Nebraska. Three Wabash errors each eventually resulted in Cornhusker touchdowns. {{Cite web|url=http://www.huskernews.com/vnews/display.v/ART/2006/05/13/4478881d5e6a8?in_archive=1|title=1908 Game Recaps|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=Husker Press Box}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.huskermax.com/1900s.html|title=the 1900s|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=HuskerMax}} {{-}} ===Carlisle===
'''Carlisle at Nebraska'''
12Total
'''â¢ [[Carlisle Indian Industrial School|Carlisle]]''' 37
Nebraska 6
* '''Date:''' 1908-12-02 * '''Location:''' Antelope Field â¢ Lincoln, Nebraska * '''Game Attendance:''' 2,000
For the second week in a row, Nebraska met a team that it would only see one time in program history. This game was arranged to bring the heralded [[Jim Thorpe]] up against the Cornhuskers. Thorpe's Carlisle team certainly did not disappoint those who came to see impressive football being played. Although Thorpe reportedly struggled at times during the game, Carlisle still easily downed Nebraska in Lincoln 37-6. {{Cite web|url=http://www.huskernews.com/vnews/display.v/ART/2006/05/13/4478881d5e6a8?in_archive=1|title=1908 Game Recaps|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=Husker Press Box}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.huskermax.com/1900s.html|title=the 1900s|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=HuskerMax}} {{-}} ==After the season== Coach Cole finished his second year with a Nebraska career total of 15-4-1 (.775), and the Cornhuskers program record again improved slightly to 108-41-6 (.716). Nebraska finished 2nd in the Missouri Valley Conference, and had an abbreviated two-year conference record of 3-1 (.750). This was the last year Nebraska played home games at Antelope Field. Next season, the new Nebraska Field was built on campus, and was located adjacent to where [[Memorial Stadium, Lincoln|Memorial Stadium]] sits today. Antelope Field was sent into the history books with an all-time Cornhusker football record of 64-8-2 (.878), including exhibition games. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{NebraskaCornhuskersFootballNavbox}} {{DEFAULTSORT:1908 Nebraska Cornhuskers Football Team}} [[Category:1908 Intercollegiate Athletic Association of the United States football season|Nebraska]] [[Category:Nebraska Cornhuskers football seasons]]
